content.en: AI Skin Diagnosis: Researchers have been investigating the use of artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning algorithms to improve the diagnosis of various skin diseases, including skin cancer. These algorithms, such as AI models and machine learning algorithms, have shown promise in accurately detecting and diagnosing nonmelanoma skin cancer, melanoma, and other skin conditions. The involvement of dermatologists in developing these AI tools is also being explored to ensure their effectiveness and reliability. Additionally, AI has the potential to support clinicians in diagnosing a wide range of skin diseases and improve the accuracy of nonexpert physicians in diagnosing skin neoplasms. Overall, AI-based tools and applications have the potential to enhance the diagnosis and treatment of skin diseases, especially in populations with diverse skin types and colors.
content.da: AI Huddiagnose: Forskere har undersøgt brugen af kunstig intelligens (AI) og maskinlæringsalgoritmer til at forbedre diagnosen af forskellige hudsygdomme, herunder hudkræft. Disse algoritmer, såsom AI-modeller og maskinlæringsalgoritmer, har vist lovende resultater i præcist at opdage og diagnosticere ikke-melanom hudkræft, melanom og andre hudtilstande. Involveringen af dermatologer i udviklingen af disse AI-værktøjer bliver også undersøgt for at sikre deres effektivitet og pålidelighed. Derudover har AI potentialet til at støtte klinikere i at diagnosticere en bred vifte af hudsygdomme og forbedre nøjagtigheden af diagnoser, foretaget af ikke-ekspert læger, når det gælder hudneoplasmer. Overordnet set har AI-baserede værktøjer og applikationer potentiale til at forbedre diagnosen og behandlingen af hudsygdomme, især i populationer med forskelligartede hudtyper og -farver.
